009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class implements line fitting by orthogonal regression to a set of 2D
022 * points using singular-value decomposition (SVD). See Sec. 10.2.2 (Alg. 10.2)
023 * of [1] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
027 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/09/29
032 * 
033 * @see OrthogonalLineFitEigen
034 * @see OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous
035 */
036public class OrthogonalLineFitSvd implements LineFit {
037        
038        private final int n;
039        private final double[] p;       // algebraic line parameters A,B,C
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor, performs a linear regression fit to the specified points.
043         * At least two different points are required.
044         * 
045         * @param points an array with at least 2 points
046         */
047        public OrthogonalLineFitSvd(Pnt2d[] points) {
048                if (points.length < 2) {
049                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
050                }
051                this.n = points.length;
052                this.p = fit(points);
053        }
054        
055        @Override
056        public int getSize() {
057                return n;
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public double[] getLineParameters() {
062                return p;
063        }
064        
065        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
066                final int n = points.length;
067                final double[][] X = new double[n][2];
068                Pnt2d ctr = PntUtils.centroid(points);
069                final double xc = ctr.getX();
070                final double yc = ctr.getY();
071                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
072                        X[i][0] = points[i].getX() - xc;
073                        X[i][1] = points[i].getY() - yc;
074                }
075                
076                SingularValueDecomposition svd =  
077                                new SingularValueDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(X));
078                
079                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
080                double[] s = svd.getSingularValues();
081                int k = Matrix.idxMin(s);
082                double[] e = V.getColumn(k);
083
084                double A = e[0];
085                double B = e[1];
086                double C = -A * xc - B * yc;
087                return new double[] {A,B,C};
088        }
089        
090}
